simulator.simobjects
Interface SimObject

All Superinterfaces:
Observable, Observer
All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicObject, SimObjectImpl
public interface SimObject
extends Observer, Observable

Simulation object which implement the observable and observer pattern to be able to connect every objects together so that they react to both internal simulation events, external events from the scenario and events received from the LAS.

Author:
erick

Method Summary
 void accept(Event event)
          Accept an event when notified by an observable object
 void attach(Observer object)
          Attach an Observer to the object which means an object implementing the accept method.
 void attach(Observer object, java.lang.Class eventClass)
          Attach an Observer to the object which means an object implementing the accept method for a specific event class
 void detach(Observer observer)
          Remove an observer from the object
 void dispatch(Event e)
          Dispatch the event to the state machine of the object
 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getCurrentStateNames()
          Retrieve the current states name (multiple names if there is concurrent state machines)
 java.lang.String getName()
          Getter and Setter for the name of the object, will be used as ID
 void notify(Event event)
          Notify every registered observer that an Event has occurred
 void setName(java.lang.String name)
           
 void step()
          Execute a simulation step by processing every events in its queue until the step delimiter is reached
